title: Police officers attempt to rescue a kangaroo from a river only for it jump straight back in
text:
The hilarious moment police officers tried to rescue a kangaroo from a river, only for the cheeky animal to hop back in, has been captured on camera.

The kangaroo was swimming in Lake Burley Griffin, in Canberra, on Wednesday afternoon when two officers on a jetski picked up the animal.

After they successfully put the roo back on dry land, two men with rope approach in a bid to tie the animal up for transportation.

However the feisty animal breaks away and hops back into the water.

ARE KANGAROOS GOOD SWIMMERS? Kangaroos are very good swimmers.

They use their tail when swimming to propel themselves.

Kangaroos swim to avoid predators.

They can use their forepaws to drown pursuers.

Source: Bush Heritage

A video of the kangaroo was posted on Reddit and social media users were bemused by the water-loving roo.

One person said: 'Obvious wants to get to the other side. Kangaroos are great swimmers.'

'He sees the writing on the wall on the mainland,' another joked.

Another referenced the classic Australian television series, Skippy.

'Sonny's drowning you gits. Follow me.'

After they successfully put the roo back on dry land, two men with rope approach in a bid to tie the animal up for transportation. However the feisty animal breaks away and hops back into the water

Though kangaroos are known for hopping through the Australian outback, they are good swimmers.

They use their tail when swimming to propel themselves in the water.

Kangaroos swim to avoid predators and can use their forepaws to drown pursuers.

ACT Police have been contacted for comment.
